text: Flesje gedeeld door Bart. Donkerbruin, troebel bier met stevig schuim. Aroma is caramel achtig. Smaak is fruitig (pruimen) en zoet. Smaak ebt snel weg.

Bottle from Beergium. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with chocolate, nuts, a bit of roasted malts, earthy notes and a bit of alcohol. Bitter finish with chocolate, nuts, roasted malts, earthy notes, a bit of alcohol and yeast. Very nice abbey dubbel.

A very dark brown, a head is huge and blond. Aroma has dark fruitness, anise, soem chocolate. Taste has dark fruits, spicyness of anise, quite dry and thats great, some harsh spices. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Tasteful, strong anise but its fitting there nicely.

0,33l Bügelflasche. Dunkelbraunes sehr trübes Bier mit dunklen Partikeln im Bier und braunem Schaum. Schönes Beerenaroma. Cassis, Brombeere, Schokolade. Im Antrunk sehr alkoholisch und geschmacksintensiv. Malz, Schokolade, Beeren. Sanft bitterer Kaffee im Abgang. Für mich insgesamt zu alkoholisch.

Trübes braun luftiger schaum der schnell zergehen, im geruch noch recht schön beerig malzig leicht holzig, Geschmack sehr alkoholisch hat was von nem Vodka wässriger Mittelteil dann würzig herb leicht holzig und mit einer Kaffee Note, nicht ganz mein Geschmack

Superbe robe brune, mousse abondante et crémeuse. Nez sur la reglisse, le cachou, le céleri, sur un fond minéral et chocolaté. Bouche à lattaque acidulée, belle rétro maltée, fine bulle raffaîchissante et finale sur une fine amertume de café. Une très belle brune équilibre, de soif.

Medvecukor színe hasonló aromák rejtekhelye, krémes habja alatt negrós, mentás illatok keverednek krémes, tejszínes, pirított magvas, élesztős elemekkel. Közepes teste továbbvisz a tapasztalt benyomások útján, medvecukros folyamban oszlanak el a gabonás, tejszínes, pörkölt, összességében azonban meglehetősen visszafogott jegyek. Elfogadható dubbel, említésre méltó tulajdonságok nélkül.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Botella 33 cl. Corte inglés Oviedo. Colección (r279) tomada en junio 2001. Lote D. Fcpref 02..2005. Buena sorpresa belga en su momento. Sabores maltosos algo tostados y cuerpo medio a intenso algo pastoso y espumoso con 8 vol. Buena. 570 pts.
Bottle, 330 ml from beerfest in Breice. Shared with JFK10000. Pours brown, medium tan head. Caramel, malty, dried fruit, nuts. Medium to full bodied. Sweetish. Very nice.
Bottle. Big creamy head. Plum, fruit, and malt flavour. Was expecting much, but maybe drinking it in summer was not a good option

F: average, creamy, off-white, average retention.
C: dark brown with red ruby tones against the light,
A: malt, apple, cherries, cocoa, caramel, liqourice, brown sugar, candy, nuts.
T: malty, dark fruits, alcohol, cherries, caramel, candy hint of honey, yeasty, medium to full body, good carbonation, good example of this style, worth to try, 0,33l bottle from Prik&Tik /Quali-drinks/ in Brussels.

33cl swiveltop bottle best by June 2018. Nose is caramel, grass and candy with latent banana. Sip adds chocolate-ish stuff, cola, fruitcake, lactose, basement aromas and hay. Roasted aftertaste. Sweet and noticeable dark chocolate bitterness.

Flaska från Beergium. Gravöl med kusin Mattias. Mörkbrun vätska med högt, tunnt skum i beige ton. Doft av karamell, fudge, inlagda körsbär, kaffe. Fin balans mellan bärigheten och de rostade tonerna. Mellanstor kropp med fin beska och mörkrost. Trevlig kombination med lite av varje i smaken: körsbär, apelsin, kaffe, kola, choklad, enbärsris, beska, torr strävhet.

Bottle at home. Very, very dark brown colour topped by a foamy but stable beige head. Rich nose and taste with roasted malty coffee and chocolate tones, caramel, dried fruits like raisins and figs, spices like clove and ginger, rounded. Good body, medium carbonation.

hazy brown colour, huge, creamy, though not too stable and long lasting beige head; aroma of dried fruits (plum, some figs and sour cherry), some herbs, liqueur, anise notes, hints of rye bread and alcohol; taste is the same with some roasted sugar; nice one!

Bottle at home from Pauwels, Kortrijk - BE. Color: deep dark brown beer almost black no carbonation and small ivory brownish head. Smell: roasted malt caramel, belgian yeast, soy sauce. Taste: medium body with roasted malt and soy sauce. Small anise taste. Caramel and alcohol finish. Not very well balanced. Aftertaste: caramel roasted malt, dry sensation. Alcohol.

Cloudy dark brown color, minimal tan head. Aroma is alcohol and some unusual fruit plus figs and rotten strawberries. Taste? What a rollercoaster. Fruity, sweet and bitter, then turns to really sweet with again rotten fruit notes, ends with sour grapes. Livlely carbonation, medium body. //bottle bought at Brezice beer festival

33 cl bottle at home. Pours copper brown with big, off white head. Aroma: red fruits, apricot, brown sugar. Little yeasty and musty. Taste: High sweetness with medium low bitterness. Spicy finish. Licorice, malts, yeast. Texture is slick. Carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do... cos im sie nie nacielo (bo ten system) - Lot 3 C. Tak czy naczej - gushing przy otwieraniu. Piana bardzo wysoka i brzydka dosc, nierowna, ale opada do trwalej, drobnej, kilkumilimetrowej warstwy, ktora juz zostaje do konca (wspomagana grawerem na dnie szklanki). samo piwo brazowo-czerwono-miedziane, przejrzyste. Aromaty glownie owocowe (wisnie, sliwki), karmelowo-toffi, gdzies w tle lekka zbozowosc, moze slad czekolady. W ustach powyzsze sie potwierdza, nieco czuc tez alkohol, ale nieprzeszkadzajaco, slodkawe, kwaskowate, dosc wysoko wysycone. DObre, choc nie wyrozniajace sie piwoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Magnifique robe brune avec quelques reflets rouges, immense col de mousse beige/brune à cratères. Nez dautomne, caramel, marrons, biscuit, épices. Bouche sucrée, douce, faible amertume, arômes de biscuit, caramel, céréales, crème de marron. Corps rond, longueur moyenne.

Flaska från Beergium. Mahoghyfärgad, klar, högt bestående skum, en hel del sediment varav en del som flyter runt på ytan i glaset. Söt maltig doft med torkad frukt, honung, Kraftig med rejäl sötma som ändå är hyfsat balanserad med väl integrerade smaker. Ganska fruktig med plommon, körsbär, viss kärnbeska. En stiltypisk stabil dubbel. Gott

330ml flip-top bottle. Murky copper brown color. Tiny size, thin beige head, disappears. Burnt sugar, caramel, sweet, dried plums, faint cocoa in aroma. Roast, sweet, metallic, papery yeast, dry dusty hops, alcohol in taste. Sweet malts, tiny bit of acetone in dry yeasty paper in aftertaste. Up to medium carbonation. Alcohol is present, but drinkable.
0,33l fles gedeeld bij bryan. Typisch Belgisch bruin zoet en verder weinig smaaksensaties.Body Is redelijk vol. Niet mijn stijl

Bottle at home. Over a year old bottle. Pours a hazy deep, reddish brown color with a creamy, ivory head. The aroma have lots of raisins, dark wood, nuts, heather, herbs, cocoa, roasted malt, brown sugar and milk chocolate and some alcohol. The flavor has more wood, rye bread, nuts and alcohol. Quite light for a dubbel. Has a medium body, slick mouth feel, and a light bitterness. Nice aroma but Im a bit disappointed that the taste didnt follow up. A decent dubbel anyhow.

Dark brown body, medium creamy head. Aroma of toffee, apple..., candy sugar and light chocoloate notes with some liquorice. Flavour has toffee, cococa, apple. Unpleasant hops... Medium body, medium-high carbo. It taste flawed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown colour, big beige head, aroma of barnyard, yeast, anis and brown sugar. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium body, oily texture, fizzy carbonation.

330 ml bottle. Unclear reddish amber body with a nice, dense off-white head. Aroma has malt and liquorice. Flavor is sweet malt with lots of liquorice and low bitterness. Medium body and average aftertaste. A bit one-dimensional with liquorice dominance.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Mørk uklar farge. Mye karbonert. Tynn skumtopp. Smaker malt, karamell, kandis, gjær og hint av røde bær. Ganske god
First whiff out of the bottle of yeast. In the glass, lively champagne aroma. Brownish foam head. Sweet organic apple juice taste. Watery flat carbonation. Aftertaste notes of alcohol.

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet, Tromsdalen. Drukket i Skibotn 14 Mar 14. Mørk brun. Nesten ikke skum. Forsiktig karamellaroma. Smaken søt karamell & malt. Ukomplisert øl med alkoholen godt kamuflert. Litt krydder i avslutninga. Gjørmete siste kvelling. KI=8.

I think that this bottle must have been the rotten egg in the pilen. It didnt have any CO2 when i opened the bottle. It has no head. The taste is old and tired fruit with a malty sweetness. It should be good until 2017.

Lukt: Frukter og krydder.
Utseende: Brun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum.
Smak: Fruktig frisk smak, noe krydder.

330ml swing-top bottle, thanks to Finn. Pours a cloudy red-brown body under a relatively stable, creamy, beige head. Not much lace. Aroma of brown malts, nuts and earth, as well as dusty hops. Flavoured with honeyed caramel malts, anise, cocoa powder and plums. Underlying yeasty fruitiness to a mid-sweet ending. Smooth on the swallow. Mostly masked alcohol. Good drinking (Tromsø 15.03.2015).

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby-hued clear brown body with a medium creamy light beige head. Nose is tart red berries, star anise, raisins, caramel and hints of citric peel and herbs. Strange. Taste is caramel, grains, anise, grains and hints of cinnamon, citric peel and herbs. Strange again. Medium body, medium to high carbonation. This is a really weird dubbel, or brune, for that matter. Whats with the herbal anise thing? Dunno. OK beer though, but not fantastic.
Flaska från Saveur Bière. Smak och doft av jäst, torkad frukt framförallt plommon, farinsocker, karamell med toner av choklad. Fruktig, stor sötma, fin beska, rund och len i smakerna.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A black beer with sparkling dark brown hues ; big beige creamy head ; medium retention. Spicy licorice aroma, anise, roast, light caramel, prune, herbs : beautiful landscape ! Medium to heavy sweet, warming background. Medium voluptuous body, thin texture, average carbonation, medium sweet finish. Overall, odd feeling of security : seriously?! how can you resist this spicy fruity roasty aroma... cradled like a baby.
0.33 flaske. Mørk klar mørk hvit skum som varer. Smak av malt gjær. Mild og fin veldig god

DWF; Bottle 0, 33L, with a flip top. Pours hazy cobber with a moderate, creamy, somewhat lacing and lasting off-white head. Aroma is toasted malt, caramel, yeast, dark fruiy, nuts and spice. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter with a lasting nutty, spice finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is avarage.
Brun med lavt skum. Aroma av litt tørket frukt, ellers lite. Smaken er malt og tørket frukt. Medium konsistens.
*Old rating, best before 01/08.  Mild-weich, dickflüssig, weinig-holzige Töne, dunkle Früchte, nett.

33 cl bottle at home. Gushed on opening, then poured well, although the head very quickly disappeared. Brown in colour with a nice red tint against the light. Not much aroma, perhaps some roast malt. Taste is on the sweet side with a little balancing bitterness. That said, this is not an overly sweet beer, there is plenty of grain in the taste. The mouthfeel is slightly thin, though. Aftertaste of nice, roasty, grain. Overall, not bad, perhaps a little bit boring.

Brown body. A thin, white head. Beautiful lacing lasts longer than the beer. Dried fruit and some alcohol nose. Low, but fizzy carbonation. Medium to light body. Sweet. Raisin, figs, dried fruit, some malt and wort flavour. A bit to thin and flat in my opinion.

The classic Bon-Secours, since 1996. Deep bronze coloured beer under a thick and creamy, yellowish beige head; very estery aroma, overripe peaches and plums, chocolatey and caramelly malts, liquorice and perhaps a hint of aniseed; sweet taste, full and creamy mouthfeel, caramelly malt sweetness, very yeasty, dryish finish but some candi sweetness lingering too. Nice and probably an interesting ale for cellaring.

0,33L bottle (from Wine of Galilee), BB 2018. Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet, intense raisins, malt, yeast. Flavor is sweet, dark fruits, caramel, malt, raisins. Finish is burnt with raisins, some bitterness, some warming alcohol, and some metallic notes. Body is thin to medium. Overall: I just love the raisin character in these kinds of brews. If it had more body, it would great, now its just very good.
Bottle. Brown pour, thin creamy tan head. Aroma is sugary, roasted malts, quite spicy and with licorice. Flavor is sweet caramel malts, spicy and smooth. Quite full bodied and loads of licorice.

Fizzy slightly, a dirty beer like a good dubbel should be. Enjoying this more than I expected

Bottle from De Zwart in Wilnis.

Beugelfles 33cl. Rood bruin van kleur. Smaak is vrij vlak. Schuimkraag blijft niet echt lang staan zodat uiterlijk niet echt uitnodigt tot drinken. Al met al best een te drinken bier, maar zijn betere in deze stijl.

Bottle @ home.Birra marrone , velata, con schiuma beige fine ed abbastanza persistente. Aroma speziato, di noce moscata , tostato di caramello, caffè, nocciola e liquirizia. Alcool e leggero sentore erbaceo sono presenti. Gusto abboccato, di caramello, tostato di liquirizia, frutta rossa , ribes da un tono acidulo. Poco amara. Corposa, poco carbonata, rotonda. Calda , equilibrata ed armonica

Bottle 33cl. Foam plentiful with excellent resistance, 
lightly bitter, long finish, frothy, Malt coffee, bread,
Couleur brune et mousse brune. Nez bien malté et épices. Gout malté sucré, malt grillé, levures, notes de fruits noirs et caramel. Bien cremeuse en bouche, pas mal.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl, couleur noire, mousse blanche très vive, effervescence très importante. (la bouteille a pété à louverture comme souvent avec la brasserie) Odeur grillée et sur le fromage bleu, goût grillé et caramélisée et arrière goût de bleu, étonnant ce goût de fromage.

Quelle merveille! Comme souvent avec les bières belges, la puissance du bouquet darômes est aussi intense à la dernière gorgée quà la première.
Pain dépices, café léger,subtile torréfaction, une brune aux reflets ambrés et une magnifique longueur en bouche.
Une bière brune belge dans la plus grande Tradition des Pères Brigittins, mais qui manque un peu de corps.
Net zoals het blonde bier is het uitzicht mooi maar is er niet veel speciaals aan de smaak
33cl bottle thanks to Beerhunter111. Color is quite dark. Head is thin to medium and beige. Body is soft. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Aroma is roasted, coffee, caramel, light yeast.
Poured daark reddish brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of sweet candy, light liquorice, dark fruit. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter, residual fruitiness.
Donker bruin bier zonder schuim. Smaak is zoet, drop en anijs. Blijft gemiddeld hangen. Smakelijk bier, jammer dat er geen enkel "leven" in zit.
Medium brown mokka head, black colour with some brown flow, sweet caramel flowery some caramel smell, medium to high carbonation low bitter, some coffee caramel liquorise like taste a bit flat..
Hazy and dark brown. Strong aroma and taste of dark malts, dark dried fruits. Also liquorice and a dry, woodiness.
(3 Jaar Verouded Version) Geruch röstmalzig, holzig, fruchtig, trocken. Geschmack röstmalzig, Karamell, schokoladig, dunkle Früchte.

Pours a drop amber color with a tan head. The smell is drop rich fruit, mild sourness. The taste is rich malt, dark fruit, nice tart sponges, vineous. The body is medium a bit oily with active fine carbonation.

In Leuven at the ZBF. 3 years aged version. Pours clear chestnut brown, hazy with a tick dark ivory head. Nose: dry fruits, tons of raisins and prunes. Mouth: complex sourness, tart, wood and sweet notes. Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Soft brown beer with a frothy head, aroma of mocha and a hint of anise, has a bitter aftertaste.
Bottle at home... Deep brown... Massive tan head... Soft sweet berry... Light yeast.. Raisin nose... Juicy Deep roast... Light fizz... Deep berry roast... Lught toasted sugers... Ruch dark malts

Horeca 13 
Pours clear dark brown 
Good white head 
Smell is sweet 
Taste is sweet , bit metallic . Sugary earthyness . Ok .

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark mahogany with huge head. Aromas of roasted malts, dried coffee, orange peel, and dark fruit. Flavors of coffee, dry chocolate and heavily roasted malts. Full, dry, with maybe a tinge of cream. Excellent Brune.

Bottle (33 cl swing-top) from bierzwerg.de. Hazy deep reddish brown, large beige head. Slightly cloying perfumy and spicy yeast aroma, dark fruits and figs, and some roasted notes. Meidum bodied, medium to high carbonation. Semi dry, low to medium bitterness.
Tasty Belgian dubbel beer. Caramelised dark malt and spicy yeast. Some dark fruits as well.

Very brown, non-transparant beer with a slightly brown firm foamy head. It has a slightly sour aroma like oranges. It tastes a bit sour in the beginning, but this turns bitter quick quickly, with a touch of alcohol. It has a slightly bitter aftertaste which doesnt last long. 

Enorm bruin, ondoorzichtig bier met een bruine stevige kraag. Licht zurig aroma, vals van sinaasappels. De smaak is heel even zuur, maar vervolgens bitter achter op de tong met hints van alcohol. De nasmaak is licht bitter maar blijft niet lang hangen.

0,33 flaske fra hjørnekiosken, på hotellrommet siste kvelden i Brussel: idet patentkorken vippes elegant av stiger en forførerisk aroma mot nesen - bjørnebær, rips, solbær og kaffe fra et kvalitetsbrenneri i skjønn forening. Voila! Dette er inspirerende saker som enhver nanobrygger må strebe mot. Den beste anvendelsen av 3,50 euro på denne turen. Biere vivante!! står det på etiketten, og det tiltredes herved - levende øl er godt øl, godt øl er å leve.

Intéressante, amertume correcte et belle longueur un peu torréfiée. Et surtout, pas doucereuse

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. Dark brown with off-white head. Aroma and taste of lightly roasted malt, some chocolate and dark fruits. Taste follows and adds coffee and alcohol. Pretty harsh, still nice thou
Tap på OC. Lite brända brödtoner. Inget jag kommer köpa igen direkt. Men den funkar efter en Patti smith konser.

33 cl. bb Dec. 2015. Pours an opaque mahogany with a huge head that settles into a small disc of creamy foam. Nose of sarsaparilla, toffee, orange zest, chocolate and raisin. Tastes of dried dark fruits (blackberry, raisin, cherry, plum, prune) balanced by an earthy bitter spiciness that tastes like a blend of citrus zest, licorice and aged woody hops. Medium body is soft with a smooth carbonation, and shows just a touch of warmth. The pleasant earthy-spicy finish keeps the big malts nicely in check.
Brune acajou, col brun clair, crémeux, épais et persistant. Chicorée assez présente, chocolat noir, douce amertume, un rien métallique, huileuse avec une petite sécheresse sur la fin.

Dark brown color nice off-white head. Slightly roasted malt and some chocolate and dark fruits hints. Flavor is quite the same as aroma but with hints of coffee and something else that I couldnt notice.  High carbonation with a dry finish.

AROMA: licorice, dark fruits, mocha
APPEARANCE: brown, clear, white foam, frothy, minimal head, 
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
PALATE: full body, oily feel, lively, astringent, bitter, long finish, 
OVERALL: a solid Belgian ale, especially good taste and palate, aromas are not my favourite (mocha...)

Bottle 33 cl. Pours dark brown in color with a thick and creamy tan head. Dark chocolate and light vinous 
notes in aroma. A bit of malty sweetness too. Feels light considering the abv. Dark fruity tones, hints 
of spices and notes of bitter chocolate in taste.
Bottle @ home... It pours clear brown with a medium beige head....The aroma is malt, molasses and caramel.....The flavor is dark fruits, light roasted malts, molasses, some spices and licorice....
33cl from the local supermarket. It pours a dark brown in colour with a thick head that diminish to a small layer. Low to medium carbonation. Soft and creamy.

33 cl. flip top bottle @ home, bought somewhere in Belgium. Pours very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, flowers and hops. Upon tasting tones of chocolate and coffee come to the surface. Soft carbonation and a very long aftertaste. Great beer.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2013 33cl bottle.
Appearance: almost no head, brown beer.
Nose: lots of caramel, red fruits.
Taste: caramel, red fruits, the bitterness in this beer doesnt work for me, I think the beer was somewhat oxidated (checked expiration date, should have still been good though), chocolate noticeable, some liquorice candy

33 cL bottle into an Achel glass.  Pretty much black beer with a healthy bubbly head.  Rich, chocolate roast malt aroma.  Boozy, oily yet smooth, carbohydratey, yet it fits.  Decent, but a little lacking in subtlety.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Brussels. Rated on 21.07.2010
Aroma is sweet with malty notes, some chocolate and ripe fruits. Flavour is somewhat sweet with malty notes, semi‐dark chocolate, some coffee notes, brown sugar and raisins. Turns a bit sour after warming up in a glass. Decent.

Very dark brown with burgundy highlights and a thick beige head.
A strong nose that combines malt, caramel and/or candy sugar, enough hops to come out balanced while overall it gives a sweet impression.
The taste itself is an evolving blend of roasted malts, a decent bit of bitterness, sweet but far less so than the aroma; a very full taste, also helped by the fact that there isnt too much carbonation.
Aftertaste: more roasted malts, a slight hint of sweetness; only then the alcohol makes itself felt but never too much.
Excellent, absolutely excellent!

Bottle @ home. Brown, dark colour with a head that doesnt last (like when you pour a glass of cola). Smells wine, wood, sweet, some alcohol, a bit sharp. Tastes wood, raisins, red fruits, a bit wine-like, some alcohol, malts. The beer feels kinda heavy and alcoholic, with a full body and slightly fizzy carbo. One to drink slowly.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Paragonable a one extreme stout beer, drink at draft, black color with rich beige head... very roasted aroma, the taste is of coffee, liquirice and dark chocolate, long and bitter finish...product with heavy personality!  i like this beer...
Dark brown coloured beer with a white head. Strange malty aroma and a sweet chocolate taste. Strange brew. (Bottle 33cl)

On tap at La Porte Noire, Brussels.
Amber color, good foam.
Aromas of malt, some fruitiness
Medium body & complexity.
Well balanced, some sweetness

Tall necked brown flip-top bottle: 33cl. Poured into a Hoegaarden Grand Cru badged stemmed tulip two years before its best before date of July 2013.

All this breweries beers seem to explode out the bottle, this one was no exception. This time I was ready for it and didnt lose a drop, the sediment however comes up with the rest of the brew, so you get everything in the glass.

Dark rustic brown body, too deep in colour to see through (plus the sediment is in there somewhere. Huge light brown head on top, which left plenty of lacing as the beer level sank during the tasting.

Aroma of burnt, roasted and toasted malts, without the sweet molasses smell often found in Belgian brown ales.

This isnt a sweet brown in any way, those malts in the smell hit you hard in the taste and a tart bitterness comes along as the mouth dries: this is more complexed than your average Belgian brown.

The alcohol content can be found easily enough, as the body isnt as rich and deep as the brew indicates by looks. Still fine, but this isnt a thick, heavy brew at all, it isnt watery either.

I enjoyed it.

Ein wenig später und nach der Eingewöhnung des Gaumens erkennt man dann doch auch eine leichte Fruchtigkeit im Hintergrund.

Toast-malty and pretty complex taste with notes of caramel, liquorice and fruity elements; sweet and bitter, toasty finish with spices and a tinge of herbal hops. Aromatic and quite complex brew.
Beugelfles met teveel druk onder de "kurk". Het spoot alle kanten op. Wel lekker beetje teveel alcohol zweem.

Deep brown beer with a thick rocky head that falls back fairly quickly.  The aroma is fairly malty but there is also a nice chocolatey character.  Wheaty spice with a dusty/earthy dryness on the back.  Not a lot of plum but there is a slightly wild earthy character.  Some light lemony citrus.  A much lighter take on the style than most versions Ive had.  Some light anise and possibly some coriander.  Fairly unique brew.

[Odense Tasting.] 
A bomb sounded when I opened it and the great drops hit all the beernotes. Abbey look and a huge longlasting head. Notes of dried fruits, chocolate, spices (coriander), carbonated, belgo sugar, toffee and some yeast. A great brewery!

Muddy brown with a lasting white head. Aroma immediately shows coriander, then malty notes and some dried fruit. Very spicy dry flavour with some alcohol presence. Hint of roast malt in the aftertaste.

Bottle @ ChristianScheffel tasting. [thank you, BeerBiker]
As Peter opened this a loud pop was heard and there was Caulier all over the table :o)
Pour is nice deep brown with red edges and a big, big, beige creamy head that takes some time to disappear. Aroma is deep, roasted, plums, chocolate, yeast and dried fruits. Low carbonation making the feel rather oily. Flavour is very nice as well - sweet but with a nice array of chocolate, Belgian sugar, fruityness and caramel. Great Dubbel.
Robe brune foncée surmontée dune mousse beige épaisse en dentelle qui persiste. Arômes dalcool, de cerises et de caramel. Saveurs dalcool, de caramel, de chocolat et de levures.
Bu au Mondial 07. Brune foncée vaseux, mini collet. Arome légé dépice malté. Goût de malte caramelisé épais, avec des notes dépice doux.

Bottle. Medium brown color with a large frothy good lacing mostly lasting off-white to light brown head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, moderate yeasty, sugar, fruit ! Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic, light to moderate bitter with short to average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Popped open and bursted out of the bottle. Dark brown coloured beer, average carbonation with a huge off-white head. Roasted malty aroma. Full body, smouth touches. Finish is bitter roasted, toches of alcohol.

It was a bit dark in the bar, but this appeared caramel-colored under a cream-colored skin which left a slight, watery lace. Aroma finds an estery layer of fruit hovering above a well-malted base. What a great, sweet, malted presence in the flavor with a touch of grit on the tongue and light acidity to finish. A sweet & sour medley that works oh-so-well.
<font size=-4>Via bottle on <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/events-detail.asp?eve @ <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/illinois/chicag Chicago, IL 60640</font>
swing top bottle.  Similar to their blonde; a good beer but it was lacking something extra to make it a great beer.
Bottle. High off-white fluffy lasting head. Clear dark brown body. Caramel cocoa coffee hay aroma. Sligly bitter caramel butter flavor.

Tap at Chr. firtal, Odense:: Murky brown with a thick white head. Sugar, bread, malty caramel/toffee sweetness. Filling body. Touch of dark fruits like raisins/plums. Very good finish that is lasting. A good Belgium bruin!

At the 2007 Big Beer, Belgians, & Barleywines Festival in Vail. Pours a cloudy brown with a large off white head. Candy, yeast and bread in the aroma. Flavor has anise and raisins but mostly a big candy sweetness. medium carbonation, and discernable hop in an attempt to balance.

(Bottle)  Pours a murky brown body with a medium beige head.  Aroma of candi sugar, dates, mustiness, florals, raisins, and sourness.  Flavor of dark fruits, toasted oats, and brown sugar with nice carbonation.
Good! Dark color. Caramel, roasted, liqourice. Not too sweet. Good bottle conditioned carbonation.

33 cL bottle. Pours with extreme head, creamy and lightbrown/off white. Brown unclear colour. Aroma is caramel, hops and yeast, some sweetness and malt beneath. Taste is plum, sugar, caramel, alcohol and roasted malts. Alcohol, fruity hops and bitterness continues into the aftertaste. Complex brew :)

750 ml bottle. Best before 04/07 notched on label. 
Murky ruby, 1 finger tan head that settles quickly to a thin layer. Patchy lace.

Lively, Champagne like carbonation

Aroma is very plummy, with some yeast, and fresh grass.

medium body.

Flavor is prune, chocolate, yeast, sugar.

Finish is long and slightly sweet. 
 
Alcohol is well hidden.

[2L bottle says best before 2001 from Magic_Dave6 and Little_hawk for my 21st birthday] Rich aroma of jamaica cake, clove spiked tangerine floating in pedro ximenez sherry, slightly oxidised with age in a good way, notes of hazelnut and almond, still fruity, notes of plum and strawberry, massively complex, chocolate and toasty notes, earthy like a cork gardening mat sitting in wet soil, background notes of chocolate, coffee and iron oxide. Full body with a tickling carbonation, milk chocolate and prunes are prominent on the palate with cookie dough and cherry notes providing depth. Alcohol is well concealed but a slight peppery alcohol note comes through on the long, dry finish. Excellent at this age.

GarethYoungs 21st birsthday diner. 2L bottle use by date 2001. Aroma gives yeast fruity esters with some oxidation and marzipan, some grassy hops and sweetish malts come through also. Taste is similar though a bit thinner with more bitterness tha n epected, but very drinkable, as it fuckin should be since we have a 2 litre bottle of the stuff!
330ml bottle. Pours cloudy and brown. Aroma and flavour of malt, toffee/caramel and some slight fruity sourness. Very average Belgian ale.

0.33l bottle at home. Deep brown color with beige head that faded very quickly. Smell of caramel. I would say it has dark chocolate taste with slight hint of bitterness. Very nice beer, I enjoyed every sip of it.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2008 Opaque brown body with a large off-white head.  Aroma of cake and coffee.  So far these Bon Secours are a safe harbour to me.  Taste has lots of toffee, a good amount of bitter black chocolate and some cookies.  Full body, medium carbonation.  Nothing fancy but well put together.  Cute flip-top bottle, nice body and filling taste, another good Bon Secours.  Bon Secour means Safe Harbour and thats exactly what these underrated beers are to me.

Nice white head. Refreshing Saaz hops, only as a second beer, and after food.Caramel, sugar, some roast, some wood.  An experiment. More bitter than your average Belgium. Good yeast, some chocolate malt, nicely done for what it is. Also I am a sucker for pop-top bottles. It popped.

Bottle, BB 07/05... little late on this one, but I think it held up fairly well.  Poured a lovely deep garnet with a short layer of uniform beige head.  Enjoyed the nose of rich, spiked dark fruits (plum and prune primarily), chocolate, and some spices.  Flavor was a bit on the tart and stale side... rich chocolate, candi sugar, and dark fruity malts across the middle with bitter herbs, alcohol, and faint citrus tartness around the edges... alcohol was a bit sharp in the flavor... bakers chocolate and brown sugar at the dry, moderately bitter, and boozy finish.  Solid brew.

Pours deep dark brown with a nice head that faded rather quickly. Aroma is wonderful. Rich malts and slightly nutty. Smell was better than the taste. Dont get me wrong, the taste was good but seemed a tad sour compared to the aroma. Still a wonderful beer.

Bottled. Dark brown colour, huge brown creamy head. Roasted malts in aroma, along with burnt sugar and hops. Lovely nose. Flavour is roasted malts, along with coffee and some caramel. Hops along with redwineish notes in finish and aftertaste. Also coffee stays long. Pleasant palate, quite creamyish. Definitively my favourite of the Bon Secours. Alcohol is quite wellhidden, but gives a slight warming touch to the beer.
Bottle. Roasted, sweet aroma. Slightly muddy brown colour. Light brown head. Roasted, vinous flavour, a bit sour. Good mouthfeel, slightly swelling.

Bottled. Hazy reddish brown color with thick head. Chocolatey maltiness, sweetness, parfumy fruitiness, some alcohol and raisins in the aroma. Chocolatey and bready flavor with sharp and peppery alcohol bite. Sweet breadiness and coffee in the finish.
Bottle. Brownish colour with a medium mostly lastiong light brown head. Aroma and taste of malts and spices. Decent beer.
Dark brown with light brown head. Sweet copper caramel smell, sour burnt wood and sweet caramel flavor.

Bottle. Very nice. fairly similiar to the Vicaris Generaal, which me and maeib had this alongside. Hints of caramel/toffee, brwon sugar and light hints of chocolate, with a slight coriander (????) spiceyness, just as there was in the Generaal. Soft carbonation on the finish. Very pleasant.
Nut brown, small beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, fruits, alcohol, sugar, wine. Bitter fruity and spicy flavour, licorice, plums. Strong coffee and bitter finish.

Bottled - Beer Circus - Croydon.  A chestnut brown coloured beer with a good off-white pillow of a head.  The beer did gush slightly on opening.  The aroma has candy sugars together with brown bread and some fruitiness.  The taste is malty and bready with alcohol soaked raisins.  Very nice indeed.
Pours a dark reddish brown color with a fairly thin white head. Caramel, dates, brown sugar in the aroma. Flavor continues with the caramel flavors with a tangy finish. Decent stuff.

330 ml bottle poured a hazy dark reddish brown with a lasting tan head. Aromas of raisins, spices, dark chocolate and yeast. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of dark fruit, spices, a hint of chocolate and some yeast with a smooth bittersweet finish.

Bottle. Hazy dark brown with a fluffy tan head. Spicy, yeasty aroma with notes of chcolate, caramel and nuts. Yeasty and a bit sweaty flavour with notes of raisins and light chocolate. Yeasty and nutty aftertaste with a bit too sharp carbonation. Hints of rum too. Quite good but a bit unpolished.
Bottled(330ml). -dark brown coloured, soapy beige head, medium sweet malty and slightl caramel aroma, nice alcohol spicy notes, too sweet finish

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2007 Bottled. Much dark brown color with light reddish glares. A lot hazy and dense with an optimal and extended fizz. Determined but not totally typica abbeyl scent, light notes of wine cellar mixed with roast malt, bitter cacao and alcohol. Lively and much racy taste, not too much full bodied and imposing, drinkable and with a determined and extended bitter on the end.

Beautiful dark color, nice malty aroma. Head dissipates quickly. Slightly fizzy, but tastes much lighter than it appears. A little fruit sweetness, but not as thick a taste and mouthfeel as the color/aroma would suggest.
Very deep cherry red with a big creamy slightly off-white head and a sweet candy aroma. The taste is sweet and filled with fruits (but i was expecting just a bit more out of it) Still very nice.

Dark brown, murky color. Little brown head. Strong chocolate, sweetness and mild alcohol in aroma. Also mild spices, not very ordinary aroma. Medium bodied. Chocolate, spices and mild vinous tones in start, ends with dry flavor. Aftertaste lasts with dryness and medium alcohol. Somehow thin and not very well balanced flavor, still good brew.

(33cl bottle) Opaque dark brown body with enormous beige head,  Aroma is medium sweet, herbal, some sour cherry, faint anise.  Taste is moderately sweet, brown sugar, herbal, plum, some cherry.  Light body, alcohol well hidden.  Seems like it is a cross between a dubbel and a Flemish Sour.

This brown ale poured with a sparse tan head. The flavor is malty and fruity with a carbonated mouthfeel and  a slightly chalky finish. After the beer warms a bit, a plum-like characteristic becomes noticeable. This is a nice version of the dubbel style.
Aroma di malto e caramello con qualche nota speziata. Gusto di malto caramellato e tostato, bilanciato egregiamente con una buona luppolatura. Lalcol risulta ben nascosto e quasi impercettibile.

Bottle shared with Blankboy and DougShoemaker -- courtesy of a generous individual.  Strong spicy aroma.  Brown pour, thick brown head. Really nice solid Dubbel taste - malty spicy, slightly sweet.  Not overly complex, just a really solid beer I would happily drink again, which has also stood up well with age.  Thanks!!!

Aroma has a sweet malt, caramel, very dark brown, pours a tiny toffee head. Flavour has toffee, caramel, and almond. Well balannced, dry, bitter, complex for a brune. Terrific!  Thanks again to the person I cant identify.

Bottle shared with tupalev and DougShoemaker -- courtesy of a generous individual. Pours a cloudy reddish-brown with a large diminishing off-white head. Nice, mild aroma of caramel malt, wine, fruit and vanilla. Flavour follows the aroma and is quite tasty and well balaced. High alcohol very well hiden. Very enjoyable Dubbel.
Bottle. Dark brown wi th lasting off-white head. Perfumy, sweet, chocolate, little roasted, balanced, flavorful and solid brune.
From a triple bock to this, what a change! Light and fluffy, with an aromatic head. A nice soft Belgian brown, powerful, yet easy to drink.

(Bottle 33 cl) Dark amber - but far from as dark as most "Brunes". Rather limited head. Aromas are not very strong, but as soon as the first drops hit your buds its as if youre in Heaven. Malty and slightly licorice-like to start with, with some nice brown sugars as well. Vannilla and dried fruits in there too. The sweetness is quickly relieved by a dry but not overpowering bitterness. 280100
A very lively beer, too much carbonated. Beautiful brown colour with a rocky head. Not much nose, just some hint of dried fruit. A speciel dubbel from Caulier.

Pours a deep brown with a whipped tan head. Absolutely huge nose of licorice, maple, vanilla and dried fruits. Initial taste is sweet with a certain plum character but the flavors dont really come through with the promise of the aromas. The body is rather thin and watery. Best nose on any beer Ive had in a while though.

Bottle Murky brown body.  Caramel-brown head, mostly diminishing.  Nose of caramel.  Initial moderately bitter, lightly sweet finish.  Heavily bitter, lightly sweet finish.  I really like the spiciness and bitterness in the flavour.  But maybe a little bit watery.  A very nice brown beer indeed.

Slight hazy dark amber with a small beige head. Brilliant fruity candy aroma, with caramel there too. Mild caramel flavour, with some boiled lollies there too. Finish is suprisingly bitter. Medium bodied, but a bit watery in the finish. Not bad.

Great brown beer, nice big beige foam and good carbonation. Very malty aroma, soft sweetness in the nose and touches of spices and nuts. Taste is nutty, malty with  burned edges and hints of dark brown sugar. A very nice brown beer.

a sim rate:
Licquoricey and subte fruit aroma. The dark reddish appearance is alluring and similar to Westvleteren 12. Licquorice flavour becomes even more apparent in the aftertaste. Tasty and quite fruity for a brune and though its quite high in alcohol, it doesnt knock you out!

Plums and apricots in the nose with a bit of roasted toffee. Caramelized candy sugars and dark fruits on the palate with a clean mouthfeel. Vanilla flavors come in more prominently as it warms with a bit of nuts and bread. Very nice clean malty finish.
Reddish / brown colour with a frothy white head. malty aroma with hints of yeast and some dark fruit. Sweet malty flavor with lots of dark fruit and hints of yeast. Well balanced alcohol finish.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2005 Not much to look at, a muddy brown in color and clarity, but the tan head is nice.  For a while.  Nice sweet malt aroma with juicy fruits, cherries and plums.  The alcohol is barely detectable in the malty taste, but the fruits come through along with some vanilla and sweet spices.  The finish is dry and clean.  Nice dubbel.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Leaf, Chicago, IL<font size=-1>
Tawny color with small light brown head. Note of vanilla in the aroma.Malty and fruity taste with nice sweetness.

Bottled (BBE 03/2007)
Beautiful portwine ruby (after adding all extra yeast, almost brown), big brown fluffy head, lace. Aroma has plums, hops, alcohol and hints of rye bread mixed with sugar. Medium-bodied. Tasty, nutty palate. Figs and plums. In the middle alcohol carries a bit harder and metallic flavor, finishing to oaky notes. Dry aftertaste.  Excellent dubbel.
Bottle at Jacob Lövenlunds place. Brown colour with a big baige head. Light malty fruity aroma and a strong fruity nutty taste. Medium to full body and a sweet finish.

At the Brasserie Bon-Secours. Great brown beer with good beige head. Nutty aroma with nice touch of burned malts, crust af sweet bread, chessnuts, and caramel. Old fassioned brown-beer taste. Full smoothness and light burned bitterness; nice afthertaste also.
Brown, medium head. Fine malty aroma, perhaps a little laqurice?. Malty flavor. Alcohol not very present.

I sampled all three Bon Secours beers over te Christmas holiday, and they all impressed me greatly.  This one pours dark brown with a malt, toffee, fruity, aroma.  Malty, extremely fruity taste, with a firm palate.  Tons of fruit, and silky smooth.  Get ya some.

Brune très foncée avec quelques reflets rouquins. Mousse crème moyenne soutenue. Nez très intense de petits fruits, la cerise et le raisin en particulier. Les arômes de la prûne et des levures sont également perceptibles. Le palais est plutôt crémeux et laisse bien sentir le gaz carbonique quelle contient. Au goût, elle est sucrée et sûre avec un touche alcoolisée en fin de bouche. Il sagit dune excellente double.

(Bottled) The nice bottle opened with a very loud pop! Almost opaque, very dark brown color with a medium, foamy and lacy head. Very malty and caramel-syrupy aroma with dried fruit and some alcohol. Slightly sour, also sweetish flavor with lots of malt, raisins, fruit and dark bread. Medium-bodied, slightly alcoholic, foamy-carbonated palate. Easy to drink and not very sugary, thanks to the sourness. Not very full-bodied or complex, but a quite nice and drinkable dubbel overall. Clearly more alcoholic than Rochefortoise brune, despite the lower ABV.

Very dark with slim tan head. Aroma has spices, caramel, dark fruits and a bit of yeast. Well balanced sweet and sour taste with malts and caramel dominating. Medium bodied, moderately carbonated. Good.

Large head which settles nicely.  Big carbonation that keeps a nice head for the duration of the drink.  Nice rich, fruity aroma of blackberry brandy and grapes.  Bit of spices/herbs (weeds) in there also.  Color is a dark mahagony red.  Flavor is fruity with more blackberries and plums.  Medium body with a decent amount of malts.  Bit of alcohol in there also.  Warming as is goes down.  Slightly tart finish with the alcohol coming on strong.  A very good dubbel!

Dark brown with an off-white thick head of foam.  Aromas are caramel, fruiit and lots of spices, quite herbal.  Flavours are sweet malts with lots of herbal and spice to the fore.  There are even hints of Coca Cola in there (which for once isnt a bad thing).  Perhaps this, too, has that secret ingredient.  An interesting beer.

Bottle at Monks.  Poured out a nice dark brown with a reddish hue. It had a medium sized head with slight carbonation. It had a very interesting sweet/ carmel aroma that carried over into the taste. It had slight bitterness on the finish. An excelent brew!!

Sampled at Ledig Erf Biermarkt 2004. (On tap) Aroma is of malt (chocolate/caramel), fruity and some spices. Hazy, brown coloured with a firm off-white, lasting head. Taste is quite malty (chocolate/caramel), sweet, some yeast and spices, some bitterness. Much fruit (berries). Quite good.

Light brown body with a almoust white head. Nice taste of caramel and toffee. 
Well bodied with a round taste. A beer that I enjoyed for a long time.

Thick yellow-brown head, creamy, not stable; dark brown beer with beautiful reddish shine. Very powerful dark malt/caramel explosion on opening. Then more aromatic compounds; mainly dark chocolate and laurel (bay leaf). Liquorice, sweetish but with a herbal-bitter edge, some hops and of course brown and chocolate malts. Peppery finish, even peppery mouthfeel, getting a sourish edge; well bodied. Only in the aftertaste, the typical Caulier meaty yeast comes peeping. Nice brown, more than halfway decent.

on tap cafe liege belgium:  pours copper brown with a tan head.  nose mostly malty molasses. flavor continues in this fation.  toffee, caramel, rock candy sweet. not much hop flavor noted. an average belgium nothing out of the ordinary.

Earthy brown hue, fairly opaque...with a decent layer of foam floating above.
Winey nose at the start, full of dark fruits, spicy, deep, ancient, a bit of molasses and anise, too, if Im not mistaken.
Taste? Okay...pretty sweet, ...no, very sweet, no, super-sticky, ultra-treacly...massive malt at play here, some tingly hops, nice, but rather...eh, ..just doesnt rise above, shall we say...thoroughly winey, nothin but...bright, bold, and strong, but lacks any unique edge, any uplifting effervescence, or any unknown intangible that just edges it into the extraordinary...a nice, fruity, spicy drink, but lackluster on the whole.
 .

And, having just concluded the Bon-Secours trilogy, for which I paid $14.97, I can now conclude that Id have put my cash to wiser use by renting the "Ernest" ouevre on DVD.

Amazingly strong fruit aromas: green apples, pear, grapes, white pepper.  Just poured forth from the bottle.  Nice red apple, brown sugar, candy flavors.  Fairly thin mouthfeel.  Really huge frothy head.

Carbonic sweet aroma, malty, with light fruitiness. Caramel, light chocolate. Dark red brown cloudy with light tan foamy lacing head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Starts sweet, with caramel, malty, vaporous. Finish is sweet malty and salty, with light acidity and no bitterness. Alcoholic warming. After is light sweet, salts, with light bitterness.
Deep brown color with a brite finish.  Very thin head with little carbonation.  Rich malty toffey like flavors with a clean finish.  Very pleasant to drink.  Would pair nicely with a beef dish.

Much more complex than the blonde. darker witha roasty nose with hints of plum and spices.  Sugary first sip with hints of plum and alcohol.  yeasty middle is complex, providing an big array of flavors.  Spicy and sugary at the finish. Long aftertaste of sweet sugar cookies.
Dark and strong with a rich malty taste.  Strong ABV but easy to drink.  Would love to try more from this brewer.
Brown - dark amber color; big rocky head. A peculiar aroma, with a hint of sourness. Quite sweet, with loads of caramel. Strong, but lacking complexity and more hopping.

Head is initially large, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting. Body is murky dark orange-brown, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (cookie, caramel, milk chocolate), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of tangerine, coriander, toffee, and banana. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic. Theres little more than sourness to balance this thing, but I quite like the aroma.

Bottle pours a deep amber red with a nice shiny head a very good lace.  The aroma is yeasty, roasty, and maple like.  The flavor is yeasty, sweet, slightly sour, hopped, a bit roasty, and spicy with a good rich body.  Overall, it is pretty average, but a nice one to try.  Perhaps too much corriander as it warms.
Nice brown color with a nice beige head. The taste is sweet and fruity with notes of fruits and cherries. It features a nice complex slight bitter finish.

Vaguely fruity aroma, with a touch of coriander.  Weird spiciness, can't tell whether its yeast spice or by addition.  Caramelly sweet, some special B character as well, with a strong minerally iron oxide flavor, rather bloodlike.  The iron oxide flavor is too much for me I just can't handle it.  Maybe it's part of the reason I didn't like the Saaz as well.  I really can't drink this.

Hopefully I'm rating this under the correct beer - it is their 'dark'.  Fruity aroma, corriander and/or orange peel (I can't distinguish these two), bicuit, and chocolate malt.  Dark brown-red in color, minimal head.  Flavor is dominated by malt, toasty and biscuity (special roast?) with subtle corriander/orange peel notes.  Balance is close to even, maybe slightly sweet.  Mild hop presence in the flavor.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.  Interesting interpretation of a dubbel - has the malt character, and the spices add unique complexity.  Similar to Binchoise or Caracole.  I like it.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2004 2001 Rating, Large format 2L bottle
This beer was had from the impressive 2 liter bottles.  This beer has a fruity aroma to it.  It is a nice brown color with a good amount of head to it.  Well carbonated.  The taste is exquisite, a bit tart, a bit sweet with a taste that is evocative of apricots.  This beer was very enjoyable.  I really enjoyed the fruity yeast character, the apricot flavor was wonderful.
Rating; Aroma 7, App 4, Taste 9, Palate 4, Impr 17, Total 4.1
Rating, small format bottle, January, 2004
As I pop the swing top bottle it pops suddenly and a whisp of gun smoke follows.  This beer pours a deep red color, and is topped by a pale tan head.  It is very well carbonated.  Aromas of candied fruit, fruit cake, cherries and a general sweet character waft from my glass.  There is almost a fake fruitiness to this beer.  The taste is quite a bit drier than the aroma would suggest.  The fruitiness is here in the taste and still has the falseness to it in the finish as well.  No acidity to this beer, unlike the large format (2L) bottle I had in 2001.  Not nearly as good either.  The fake fruitiness is a bit distracting, it seems to be a fermentation byproduct perhaps.
Rating: Aroma 5, App 4, Taste 5, Palate 3, Impr 11, Total 2.8

On the pour a deep garnet color with a planetary sized head, frothy in texture, and a light tan color, as it slowly dematerializes a velum like sheet of lace is formed to conceal the glass. The aroma of caramel, malted grains, a bit of yeast, almost cotton candy sweet with the start quite sweet and lightly malted, top is a bit thin in feel. Finish is lenient in its acidity, the hops pleasing in their spiciness, nicely dry and once again drinkable beers, but not any thing to shout about, got some in the stash; lets see how they are this time next year.
Second-tier Belgian brown ale. Thin body, not as creamy or as malty as I expect from a good Belgian Brown.  I won't be buying this again.

Bottle conditioned. Deep chestnut, excellent off white rocky head, slight overcondition. Spicy corriander, malt and yeast aromas.  Quite thin in the mouth with fruity raisins and a metallic maltiness. Malty yeast bitter finish. None of the Bon Secours beers are anything special, but this is the best of the lot.

The aroma is very sweet with notes of sugar, yeast - a lovely complex aroma. The color is an unclear brown and it has a beutiful light brown head. The flavor is sweet, yeasty, and soft with notes of rich fruit and plums. The alcohol prickles the tongue. It ends on a slight bitterness - a very nice beer.
Bottle from JBrus.  Murky-orange.  Citric flavors: Orange, lemon.  Some pear also.  Yeastiness throughout, I liked.

Intriguing aroma with grape; odd flavor--slightly sour, notable presence of malts and yeast.  Good color and lacing.  Something root beer like here, but also something enjoyable despite a thin palate.
Aroma of grape popsicle, notes of yeast....murky halloween colored beer..brown, purple, orange edges.  Flavor was boring and uneventful.....no kick at all.
Stanky cheese, salty taste, basic Belgian "underbeer", nothing sour about it, very decent
Bottled. Muddy nut brown. Acidic cherry aroma. Sweet and dusty with notes of caramel. Malty and refreshing, despite being sugary.
Cane sugar aroma with licorice. Sweet flavor with coffee, licorice and chichorei. Bittersweet aftertaste.

Amber coloured with a medium creamy head. Malt and candy sugar aroma. The candy sugar shines through both in aroma and taste. The beer is not particularly sweet though. A rather dry, bitter finish and aftertaste.
A very long and delicate aroma of malt, toffee, nuts and caramel. Very nice dark colour with an extremely creamy head. Really bitter flavour.

This beer has the best Aroma imaginable. The appearance lived even up to that! But the rest is a bit disappointing. It was quite funny at the Restaurant "Brasserie Degas" in Copenhagen. The bottle maked a very loud "BANG" when it was being opened. Everybody was shocked. Ha. Quite bitter (too bitter) aftertaste.

Suberb spicy aroma with notes of nutmeg and wormwood. The appearance is wunderbar. Dark interesting colour with a huge and creamy head and some sediment. The flavour contains complex bitter and sweet notes. A great brew.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2003 Head is initially large, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting. Body is murky dark orange-brown, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (cookie, caramel, milk chocolate), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of tangerine, coriander, toffee, and banana. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic. There's little more than sourness to balance this thing, but I quite like the aroma. And, well, to me, half-hearted sourness in dark beers isn't much fun.
brown colour, big creamy head, nutmeg aroma with notes of orange, sweet and full, smooth with a long bitter finish - fresh and very pleasant
Aroma: nuts, spices and carbonation. Very dark brown/redish. Soft, creamy, some spices, some hops. In the end the hops are more present.
